channel.title: Deathlypvp login
channel.description: why my user and my pass its always save at the login box for all ppl and me ? how i can delete that thing ? im using deathlypvp v3

item.title: Deathlypvp login
item.dc:creator: @i_pwn_u11 i_pwn_u1
item.description:
@i_pwn_u11 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:10, topic:508477”][quote author=i_pwn_u1 link=topic=626716.msg4261239#msg4261239 date=1363476991]

delete settings.dat or something similar to that in the cache

wait what i dont undertsand

Your lack of knowledge is amazing.
Open your cache folder, find settings.dat, delete it.

Look around the client folder if you can’t find it. Use your brain. Search through the folder. Use z-FileSearcher/search bar provided with windows vista+ and search for anything involving the cache. You’ll find signlink and findcachedir… That leads you to your cache’s location.

nop its not worked i delete the thing in cache but when i relog in and relogout its the same its recome in the cache

It saves your account’s credentials. Do you want to remove the saving part of it?

yea how i do that?
[/quote]

Open client.java in your client and search for ‘readSettings()’ and ‘writeSettings()’. Post them both here.[/quote]
thanks guys i just fixed mod close it

Read full topic

item.title: Deathlypvp login
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“i_pwn_u1, post:9, topic:508477”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=626716.msg4261191#msg4261191 date=1363473321]

delete settings.dat or something similar to that in the cache

wait what i dont undertsand

Your lack of knowledge is amazing.
Open your cache folder, find settings.dat, delete it.

Look around the client folder if you can’t find it. Use your brain. Search through the folder. Use z-FileSearcher/search bar provided with windows vista+ and search for anything involving the cache. You’ll find signlink and findcachedir… That leads you to your cache’s location.

nop its not worked i delete the thing in cache but when i relog in and relogout its the same its recome in the cache

It saves your account’s credentials. Do you want to remove the saving part of it?
[/quote]
yea how i do that?[/quote]

Open client.java in your client and search for ‘readSettings()’ and ‘writeSettings()’. Post them both here.

Read full topic

item.title: Deathlypvp login
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“i_pwn_u1, post:5, topic:508477”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=626716.msg4260969#msg4260969 date=1363456771]
delete settings.dat or something similar to that in the cache
[/quote]
wait what i dont undertsand[/quote]

Your lack of knowledge is amazing.
Open your cache folder, find settings.dat, delete it.

Look around the client folder if you can’t find it. Use your brain. Search through the folder. Use z-FileSearcher/search bar provided with windows vista+ and search for anything involving the cache. You’ll find signlink and findcachedir… That leads you to your cache’s location.
